title: Album Page, "Ironwork Railing, Freudenstadt", September 13, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from top left: IV / III / IV / I / (inscribed in circle) 41 / No I / Freudenstadt / Sept 13th 1887.
description:
Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Ornamental railing with faceted, tapered newel post ending in a ball finial.  The railing consists of two levels of scrolling ornament with joints highlighted in golden yellow.  The scrollwork of the upper section terminates in small flowers, also in golden yellow.  The lower section consists of confronted scrolls joined by a flame-like central element.   In the field above and to the right of the railing are three small flowers or quatrefoils and the flame-like element drawn in greater detail.  Each is numbered I through IV, and correspond to decorative elements in the railing also noted numbers I through IV. 

Related to railing depicted in 1943-51-119, 1943-51-120.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Ironwork Railing, Freudenstadt", September 13, 1887.
September 13, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-121.
